Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate different land habitats, such as a playground, garden, or forest, and show the diverse living things found there (e.g., trees, squirrels, ants).
The student can illustrate different water habitats, such as a pond, stream, or lake, and show the diverse living things found there (e.g., fish, clams, aquatic plants).
The student can depict firsthand or media-based observations of various plants and animals within each habitat.
The student can compare and highlight the different types of living things present in each habitat through their drawings.
The student can organize their drawing to demonstrate patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
